014package org.jdbi.v3.core.internal;
015
016import java.lang.reflect.Array;
017import java.lang.reflect.Type;
018import java.util.ArrayList;
019import java.util.Arrays;
020import java.util.Iterator;
021import java.util.List;
022import java.util.NoSuchElementException;
023import java.util.Optional;
024import java.util.Spliterator;
025import java.util.Spliterators;
026import java.util.stream.Stream;
027import java.util.stream.StreamSupport;
028
029import org.jdbi.v3.core.generic.GenericTypes;
030
031/**
032 * Implements Iterator methods for unidentified arrays and Iterable things that do not
033 * have a more specific type than Object. Note that its elements will be returned as
034 * Object, primitives included (will be autoboxed).
035 */
036public class IterableLike {
037    private IterableLike() {
038        throw new UtilityClassException();
039    }
040
041    /**
042     * Returns true if the given object is iterable.
043     *
044     * @param maybeIterable the object that might be iterable.
045     * @return whether {@code IterableLike} can iterate over the given object.
046     */
047    public static boolean isIterable(Object maybeIterable) {
048        return maybeIterable instanceof Iterator<?>
049            || maybeIterable instanceof Iterable<?>
050            || (maybeIterable != null && maybeIterable.getClass().isArray());
051    }
052
053    /**
054     * Given an iterable object (which may be a iterator, iterable, primitive
055     * or reference array), return an iterator over its (possibly boxed) elements.
056     *
057     * @param iterable the iterable-like
058     * @return an iterator of the given array's elements
059     */
060    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
061    public static Iterator<Object> of(Object iterable) {
062        if (iterable == null) {
063            throw new IllegalArgumentException("can't iterate null");
064        }
065        if (iterable instanceof Iterator<?>) {
066            return (Iterator<Object>) iterable;
067        } else if (iterable instanceof Iterable<?>) {
068            return ((Iterable<Object>) iterable).iterator();
069        }
070        if (iterable instanceof Stream<?>) {
071            return ((Stream<Object>) iterable).iterator();
072        }
073
074        Class<?> klass = iterable.getClass();
075        if (!klass.isArray()) {
076            throw new IllegalArgumentException(getTypeWarning(klass));
077        }
078
079        if (klass.getComponentType().isPrimitive()) {
080            return new PrimitiveArrayIterator(iterable);
081        }
082        return Arrays.asList((Object[]) iterable).iterator();
083    }
084
085    /** Given an iterable-like object, try to determine its static (i.e, without looking at contents) element type. */
086    public static Optional<Type> elementTypeOf(Object iterable) {
087        return elementTypeOf(iterable.getClass());
088    }
089
090    /** Given an iterable-like type, try to determine its static (i.e, without looking at contents) element type. */
091    public static Optional<Type> elementTypeOf(Type type) {
092        final Class<?> rawClass = GenericTypes.getErasedType(type);
093        if (rawClass.isArray()) {
094            return Optional.of(rawClass.getComponentType());
095        } else if (Iterable.class.isAssignableFrom(rawClass)) {
096            return GenericTypes.findGenericParameter(type, Iterable.class);
097        } else if (Iterator.class.isAssignableFrom(rawClass)) {
098            return GenericTypes.findGenericParameter(type, Iterator.class);
099        } else { // not an iterable-like
100            return Optional.empty();
101        }
102    }
103
104    /**
105     * Given an iterable object (which may be a iterator, iterable, primitive
106     * or reference array), return a {@link Stream} over its (possibly boxed) elements.
107     *
108     * @return a stream of the given array's elements
109     */
110    public static Stream<Object> stream(Object iterable) {
111        return StreamSupport.stream(Spliterators.spliteratorUnknownSize(of(iterable), Spliterator.ORDERED), false);
112    }
113
114    /**
115     * Given an iterable object (which may be a iterator, iterable, primitive
116     * or reference array), return an iterable over its (possibly boxed) elements.
117     * @param iterable the iterable-like to create a real Iterable for
118     * @return the created Iterable
119     */
120    public static Iterable<Object> iterable(Object iterable) {
121        return () -> of(iterable);
122    }
123
124    /**
125     * Collect an iterable-like into a newly allocated ArrayList.
126     * @param iterable the iterable-like to collect
127     * @return a new list with the elements
128     */
129    public static List<Object> toList(Object iterable) {
130        List<Object> result = new ArrayList<>();
131        of(iterable).forEachRemaining(result::add);
132        return result;
133    }
134
135    private static String getTypeWarning(final Class<?> type) {
136        return "argument must be one of the following: Stream, Iterable, Iterator, "
137                + "or an array/varargs (primitive or complex type); was " + type.getName() + " instead";
138    }
139
140    static class PrimitiveArrayIterator implements Iterator<Object> {
141        private int index = 0;
142        private final int size;
143        private final Object arr;
144
145        /**
146         * @throws IllegalArgumentException if obj is not an array
147         */
148        PrimitiveArrayIterator(final Object obj) {
149            size = Array.getLength(obj);
150            arr = obj;
151        }
152
153        @Override
154        public boolean hasNext() {
155            return index < size;
156        }
157
158        @Override
159        public Object next() {
160            if (hasNext()) {
161                return Array.get(arr, index++);
162            } else {
163                throw new NoSuchElementException("only " + size + " elements available");
164            }
165        }
166
167        @Override
168        public void remove() {
169            throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
170        }
171    }
172}
